page.title: 13Religious beliefs.
page.content: The{Church of England}is the principal religion. One vicar, aided by a lay reader, presides over Rolleston, Upton and Morton parish churches. Services are held weekly. In Fiskerton, the fortnightly services at the{Methodist church are conducted by either the Southwell based minister or by a lay preacher. Attendance is usually poor at all the churches except for the main religious festivals. Not many{ {Roman Catholics}reside in the area. There are{Sunday schools}at Rolleston and Fiskerton but the majority of children do not attend these. {Henri's Evangelical Revival}meets every Saturday evening and on public holidays in the Methodist church. Members come from all over the country, but some, including the founder, live locally.{ }
